byline.contributor: Alison Smale contributed reporting from Berlin, and Raphael Minder from Madrid.

abstract: United Nations formally approves Antonio Guterres to be its next Secretary General; supporters hope Guterres, former Portuguese prime minister known for his diplomatic savvy, will restore credibility to UN while addressing grueling conflicts in Syria and elsewhere; critics question his ability to stand up to global powers.

headline.print_headline: Known for Nerve and Savvy, Next U.N. Leader Needs Both
headline.main: António Guterres, Known for Nerve and Deal Making, Will Need Both at U.N.

snippet: Mr. Guterres will take over as secretary general of the United Nations at a time when the credibility of the world body is under intense scrutiny....
lead_paragraph: Mr. Guterres will take over as secretary general of the United Nations at a time when the credibility of the world body is under intense scrutiny.
